summary: A Federal Bureau of Prisons memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 10, 2019, reporting a failure of the NICEVision camera system on August 8, 2019, which prevented the recovery of video footage from the 5-South Housing Unit and other cameras. The technician indicated the system would be fixed on August 9, 2019.

events.title: NICE Camera System Failure Discovered
events.description: At approximately 3:45 PM, while reviewing the NICE Camera System, the author attempted to recover video footage from the 5-South Housing Unit but was unable to recover any previous recordings. A review of all cameras revealed none were recording.

events.title: Scheduled Camera System Repair
events.description: A Communication Technician, after being notified of the failure on August 8, stated he would fix the camera system when he arrived to work on Friday, August 9, 2019.

locations: MCC New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: On August 8, 2019, the NICE camera surveillance system at MCC New York was discovered to be non-functional, preventing the recovery of any video footage.
The failure specifically impacted the 5-South Housing Unit, which is where Jeffrey Epstein was being held at the time of his death on August 10, 2019.
A Communication Technician was notified and stated the system would be repaired on August 9, 2019, the day before Epstein's death.
The document is a memorandum dated August 10, 2019, documenting the camera failure that occurred two days prior, coinciding with the timeline of Epstein's death.
